text: Manfred Edward Clynes (August 14, 1925 â€“ January 19, 2020) was an Austrian- born Australian-American scientist, inventor, and musician. He was best known for his innovations and discoveries in the interpretation of music. He would study biological systems and neurophysiology. Clynes died on January 19, 2020 in West Nyack, New York at the age of 94.Manfred Edward Clynes ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Australian musicians Category:Australian biologists Category:American pianists Category:American inventors Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Musicians from Vienna Category:Scientists from Vienna Category:Musicians from New Jersey
title: Manfred Clynes
